review_body:
I fed my cats Science Diet for years, until recently when I actually read the ingredients and did a little research.  Specifically, here are the first 7 ingredients of this food (full ingredients lists included below):
Chicken, Whole Grain Wheat, Corn Gluten Meal, Pork Fat, Powdered Cellulose, Chicken Meal, Wheat Gluten

Now compare the top 7 ingredients in Solid Gold Indoor Cat Chicken, Lentil, and Apple food:
Chicken, Chicken Meal, Lentils, Peas, Turkey Meal, Pea Protein, Pea Fiber

Which one looks healthier to you?  Here's a hint -- healthy cats do not need whole wheat, which is just an unnecessary (and cheap) carbohydrate filler, and gluten is not a good form of protein for cats and can actually cause digestive upset.  Powdered cellulose is added for fiber but is usually made from pine trees in cat food and is not healthy for cats in large quantities.  Now read the ingredients lists again.  Science Diet is about making profits with cheap ingredients, NOT making healthy cat food -- I gave it 2 stars only because at least it's made in the USA.  In fact, the excessive amount of wheat in Science Diet can actually prevent a cat from absorbing the actual nutrients in the food.  Solid Gold, on the other hand, is a holistic food that is wheat and gluten free and includes probiotics, which Science Diet does not.  They also have been around for over 40 years so must be doing something right.  After switching to Solid Gold my cats' fur went from dull and dry to shiny and soft, which to me is a good indication of overall better health and nutrition.  By the way, I've tried three different Solid Gold flavors with our guys and they absolutely LOVE them all.  I actually use the lower calorie version as a healthy "treat" for our cats and they devour it, and even a small bag is MUCH cheaper per pound than buying "special" treats that are often much less healthy.  Win win!

Now here's the kicker -- I did the math and this Solid Gold food is only 15% more expensive per pound than the Science Diet here on Amazon (using biggest bags available to compare).  That's not a lot folks, especially when it comes to your cat's health and well being, not to mention the potential to avoid costly vet bills later on.  I went with Solid Gold for its quality ingredients and relatively low cost, but there are several others that also look good (i.e. Merrick).

I took the time to write this because I wish I had known this information years ago and feel very guilty I haven't done better as a parent for my little loved ones, so I'm hoping this helps you make better decisions now.  Anyway, hope this helps and FYI here are the complete ingredient lists for both foods (notice where the fruits and vegetables fall on the list for each food):

Science Diet:
Chicken, Whole Grain Wheat, Corn Gluten Meal, Pork Fat, Powdered Cellulose, Chicken Meal, Wheat Gluten, Dried Beet Pulp, Chicken Liver Flavor, Soybean Oil, Lactic Acid, Fish Oil, Choline Chloride, Potassium Chloride, Calcium Sulfate, L-Lysine, vitamins (Vitamin E Supplement, L-Ascorbyl-2-Polyphosphate (source of Vitamin C), Niacin Supplement, Thiamine Mononitrate, Vitamin A Supplement, Calcium Pantothenate, Riboflavin Supplement, Biotin, Vitamin B12 Supplement, Pyridoxine Hydrochloride, Folic Acid, Vitamin D3 Supplement), Taurine, Iodized Salt, L-Carnitine, minerals (Ferrous Sulfate, Zinc Oxide, Copper Sulfate, Manganous Oxide, Calcium Iodate, Sodium Selenite), Mixed Tocopherols for freshness, Natural Flavors, Green Peas, Apples, Cranberries, Carrots, Broccoli, Beta-Carotene

I grew up feeding our pet dogs with Hill's Science Diet, so when it came time to chose a brand of food for my fianc's and my two kitties, it was an easy decision to go with Hill's Science Diet once again.  Our cats are strictly indoors, with the closest of going outside being when we have the screens open during warm weather.  This is the perfect indoor cat food that doesn't have many kcals per cup (some of the other Hill's specialty foods have a lot more), which is good because indoor cats don't always get the most exercise.  We try to keep ours active and they enjoy chasing each other throughout the house, but I'm sure it's not as much exercise as an outdoor cat would get.  The kernels themselves are fairly large and odd shaped.  We have an automatic feeder for our one cat and the kernels come out fairly easy but will get stuck on occasion because of the odd shape.  I can't tell you how tasty the food is, but I'm guessing quite delicious since both of our cats have been eating this for a few years!

Since we have two cats, we typically buy the larger 15.5 lb. bag and it lasts us about two months.  The cats get fed 1 cup a day total between them, if that gives you an idea of about how much we go through in the two month time span.  With the last purchase on Amazon, we signed up for the automatic shipping, which has been great!  Not only do we get a discount on the price but we also don't have to think about ordering it when we get low!  Even without the automatic shipping discount, Amazon is still the cheapest place I have found to buy this food.  When the local pet stores have sales, I can find it for $30-32.

Overall, this is a great cat food that doesn't have many kcals, our cats love, and is decently priced on Amazon.  I would highly recommend this cat food to anyone looking to give their cat(s) a quality brand.
summary: Quality Brand Cat Food at a Great Price

We also have two outdoor kitties of about the same age who belong to our neighbor but spend most of their time in our yard because we have much more vegetation.  They are 24/7 outdoor cats that we don't feed but they are wonderfully healthy.

Our own cats eat better than average wet and dry food on a managed feeding cycle but we don't fall for the hype of gourmet foods  most of that hype is part of a billion dollar industry to manufacturer cheap product (usually offshore) and sell it for a premium price using fancy names and promises.  We have used Science Diet before but we don't put any kind of faith into it being anything more than cat food. I do give them kudos that they manufacturer their product in the United States, though.

Whats in this product may not be the most premium (and not everyone can afford the most expensive) but it is better than no-name brands. Any cat owner will know that some cats will like the taste immediately and others may take time to warm up to it, while some picky eaters won't like it at all. There is no way to predict any pros or cons in terms of long-term effects on an animals health as that will differ on a per-cat basis.

All in all the product comes from a respectable source, is manufactured in the U.S. and in my case my case like the taste and have yet to throw it up. That rates as a 4-star product following Amazons guidelines.
